field.note: Note that the Asset Builder will attempt to change status AFTER any 'asset created' triggers are run. If these triggers involve changing the status of an asset automatically, you should use the 'Do not change status' option. With this option, the Asset Builder will not attempt to change the status of the asset. If nothing else changes the status of the asset, the status will default to Under Construction.

These metadata schemas will be applied to created assets. Values for these schemas' fields may be supplied by the user when creating the asset. By default, the complete interface for these schemas, exactly as it would appear in the administration interface, will be printed above the default create form for each asset type. It is recommended that the create form be customised (see below) so that the individual fields can be laid out appropriately within the form using %metadata-F_(fieldid)% keywords.
If this option is enabled, link permissions will not be checked when creating the asset. Otherwise, users must have permission to create assets in the create locations specified.

If this page will be nested (in another page, or in a design), its form will be visible at a URL different to this page's URL. Use this setting to control whether the form should submit to the same URL it's displayed at, or to this page's own URL.
If this option holds a value, each link will be created with the value. If this option is left blank, then each link will be created without a value

You may select a paint layout to apply to newly created assets. This paint layout is an asset based layout which means it will be applied to all URLs of the asset and will be inherited by all of its children.

You may select an override paint layout to apply to newly created assets. This paint layout is an asset based override layout which means it will be applied to all URLs of the asset but will not be inherited by any of its children.

If an asset type is selected for create form customisation, a layout asset will be created under this page and will be be used when displaying the create form for that asset type. Fields from the details or metadata screens may be included in the layout.
If set to 'Disable', the login forms will allow, browsers which support the attribute, to populate the password field on login screen.

If require CAPTCHA is set to 'yes' and the default bodycopy is not used, the %form_captcha% keyword or %form_captcha_image% plus %form_captcha_field% keywords must be included for form submissions to be accepted.
